structure.unit: FEES AND COMPENSATION OF PUBLIC OFFICERS AND EMPLOYEES

text.section: Chain-carriers and markers shall be paid, by the person causing the survey to be made, one dollar ($1) per day. If the survey is made under an order of court their services and the fees to which they are entitled shall be reported by the surveyor in his report.
Viewers of a road shall be paid, by the applicant, one dollar ($1) per day.
Processioners shall be paid, by the employer, two dollars ($2) per day.

law.history: Recodified 1942 Ky. Acts ch. 208, sec. 1, effective October 1, 1942, from Ky. Stat. sec. 1747.
